result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Bradly James Easland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bradly James Easland is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bradly James Easland was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bradly James Easland was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to Count 4.
Court dismisses Count 1.
Count 3 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Defendant to report to Probation today December 2, 2015 by 3:00 p.m.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 4

ADA McKinley states there is an agreement. Recites recommendations. Has complied with victims rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 2 Misd. Battery in 15CF365, Ct 3 Take and Drive Vehicle w/o consent and Ct 4 Criminal Damage to Property. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct's 3 & 4 in 15CF365.  Court finds DE guilty of amended Ct. 2 Misd. Battery in 15CF365. Court will withhold entry of conviction and judgment on Ct 3 per the deferred agreement. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1 in 15CF365. Sentencing arguments. ADA McKinley states there is a restitution amount. Has complied with victims rights. 20 Days to file appeal. Crt orders:

COUNT 2:
- S/W 2 years probation concurrent to Ct 4. Report to probation no later than 3 p.m. today. Bond will remain in effect until reports to probation.

- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

- Restitution in the amount of $1,972.93

- DNA Sample, Surcharge and Court Costs to be paid over the course of probation

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Paul T. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  

COUNT 3:  3 Years Deferred JOC

COUNT 4:
- S/W 2 years probation concurrent to Ct. 2. Report to probation no later than 3 p.m. today. Bond will remain in effect until reports to probation

-  Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

- DNA Sample, Surcharge and Court costs to be paid over the course of probation

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Paul T.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.

-Not to possess any dangerous weapons.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Paul T.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
